definition: to make one's name/to become famous
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to win success and recognition (idiom)
work that makes one's name

sentences.english: He gloried in his winning the championship.
We do know however that Susan Boyle will now get a shot at stardom.
sentences.chinese: 但我們確實知道的是波伊爾現在將一舉成名。

sentences.english: Over-night fame has become a common phenomenon in our modern society.
sentences.chinese: 一夜成名成了現代社會的家常便飯。

sentences.english: Being affected by the Super Girl Contest, many young girls dream of becoming famous.
sentences.chinese: 受超女的影響，很多花季少女都開始夢想成名。

sentences.english: Four parents all embrace for a night sudden wealth, become famous for a night of by luck mental.
sentences.chinese: 四家長都抱有一夜暴富，一夜成名的僥倖心理。

sentences.english: Cheng's wife put her money on the table, lit joss sticks and kowtowed just like others there.
sentences.chinese: 成名的妻子把錢放在案上，象前邊的人一樣燒香跪拜。

sentences.english: Edison won his spurs as an inventor while young.
sentences.chinese: 愛迪生很年輕時就因創造發明而一舉成名。

sentences.english: Where has "one ball becomes famous " anhydrous series Gao Qing press plate time be loaded with?
sentences.chinese: 哪裏有《一球成名》系列高清無水印版下載？

sentences.english: A lot of successful is forced out.
sentences.chinese: 很多功成名就是逼出來的。

sentences.english: Celine and the girl sang one of her hit song together hand in hand , looking into each other's eyes deeply.
sentences.chinese: 席琳迪翁和女孩手拉手，共同演唱了她的一首成名曲。

sentences.english: For Zeng, this was just the start of her life in the spotlight.
sentences.chinese: 對曾晶來說，這僅僅是她成名之路的開始。

sentences.english: That song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career.
sentences.chinese: 那首歌是他的成名曲，標誌着他歌唱職業生涯的開始。

sentences.english: The city is famous for Robin Hood and has a University in Ningbo.
sentences.chinese: 該城市羅賓漢成名並在寧波有一個大學。

sentences.english: These are cars which show you've arrived and had a good time along the way.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的車可以顯示你已功成名就，並且一路順風順水。

sentences.english: Here are some of the latest sensations. See what it takes to become famous.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們看看以下的網絡新星都是以什麼方式成名的吧。

sentences.english: In those years he just fought for fame.
sentences.chinese: 那些年，他只是爲成名而奮鬥。

definition: to make one's first public performance (of an entertainer etc)/to start one's career
reputation/fame
to hit the big time
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
to rise to fame
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
work that makes one's name
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to become famous/to become notorious
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
tremendously popular for a while
lit. it takes a long time to make a big pot (idiom); fig. a great talent matures slowly/in the fullness of time a major figure will develop into a pillar of the state/Rome wasn't built in a day
